body_html:
I'm a bit confused about your error message above. That is when compiling from source at head, right? In general, I'd be weary to spending time to debug that (since the code is changing frequently), but if for some reason you do need to use sources at head please to provide a full snippet that reproduces the error. For example, the following does not lead to any errors:

import tensorflow as tf
lstm_cell_1 = tf.contrib.rnn.BasicLSTMCell(1)
outputs, states = tf.contrib.rnn.static_rnn(lstm_cell_1, [tf.constant([[1.0],[1.0]], dtype=tf.float32)], dtype=tf.float32)

That said, hopefully 0.12.1 works out for you. Do let me know.

body:
I'm a bit confused about your error message above. That is when compiling from source at head, right? In general, I'd be weary to spending time to debug that (since the code is changing frequently), but if for some reason you do need to use sources at head please to provide a full snippet that reproduces the error. For example, the following does not lead to any errors:

```python
import tensorflow as tf
lstm_cell_1 = tf.contrib.rnn.BasicLSTMCell(1)
outputs, states = tf.contrib.rnn.static_rnn(lstm_cell_1, [tf.constant([[1.0],[1.0]], dtype=tf.float32)], dtype=tf.float32)
```

That said, hopefully 0.12.1 works out for you. Do let me know.
